ORDER, Re: discovery by pltfs' expert, Ward Duel, who will be permitted to conduct tours of selected correctional facilities, defts shall make available an individual who is familiar w/the ventilation system at each tour, and at each facility defts shall make available an individual who is familiar w/that ventilation system for the purpose of being deposed. Inspections and depositions are set for: Mid-Statea Corrctional Facility - 10 a.m. on Wed., 2/22/95; Maracy Correctional Facility - 10:00 a.m. on Fri., 2/24/95; Orleans Correctional Facility - 10:00 a.m. on Wed., 3/1/95; and Albion Correctional Facility - 10:00 a.m. on Fri., 3/3/95. ( signed by Magistrate Judge Gustave J. DiBianco ) (fce) (Entered: 02/13/1995)

Ward Duel shall prepare a Report based on his inspections of certain NYS correctional facilities, and a copy shall be provided to defense counsel. case_data.name: Cunningham v. Coughlin
case_data.summary:
(This summary is temporary, while we research the case.)

According to the ACLU National Prison Project 1995 Status Report about state prisons,

"In May 1992, prisoners housed in overcrowded dormitory facilities in two New York prisons filed a lawsuit challenging these conditions on the ground that they increase the risk of exposure to

tuberculosis. TB screening and access to adequate treatment are also at issue. Cunningham v. Coughlin, No. 92-CV-0579 (N.D.N.Y.). A class has been certified."
